statements: SELECT * FROM customer_data;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM customer_data WHERE age > 30;
SELECT * FROM customer_data WHERE gender = 'Female';
SELECT city, state FROM customer_data WHERE age < 25 ORDER BY city ASC;
SELECT * FROM customer_data WHERE state = 'California' OR state = 'New York';
SELECT * FROM customer_data WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY last_name DESC, first_name ASC LIMIT 10
SELECT first_name, last_name, city FROM customer_data WHERE gender = 'Female' ORDER BY city
SELECT customer_id, first_name, age FROM customer_data WHERE state = 'California' AND city = 'San Francisco'
SELECT * FROM customer_data WHERE age BETWEEN 25 AND 40 ORDER BY age ASC
SELECT customer_id, age, gender, city, state FROM customer_data WHERE city IN ('New York', 'Los Angeles')
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, age, city, state FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, city, state, zip_code FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, city, state FROM customers ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, product_name, quantity, price FROM customers JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, city, state FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female';

SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, purchase_date, product_name, quantity, price FROM customers JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id WHERE price > 100 ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, city AS location FROM customers WHERE state IN ('California', 'New York');
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, age, city, state, zip_code FROM customers WHERE age BETWEEN 25 AND 40 ORDER BY customer_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, age FROM customers;
SELECT product_name, category, price FROM products WHERE price > 50;
SELECT * FROM purchases ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(product_id) AS total_products_purchased FROM purchases GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT first_name, last_name, age, city FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY age DESC, city ASC
SELECT product_name, category, price FROM products WHERE price < 50.00 ORDER BY price ASC
SELECT customer_id, product_id, purchase_date, quantity, total_amount FROM purchases WHERE quantity > 5 ORDER BY purchase_date DESC
SELECT first_name, last_name, city FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female' ORDER BY city ASC, last_name DESC
SELECT product_name, category, stock_quantity FROM products WHERE stock_quantity < 50 ORDER BY category ASC
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, age FROM customers;
SELECT * FROM purchases WHERE quantity > 10;
SELECT DISTINCT state FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(purchase_id) AS purchase_count FROM purchases GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT first_name, last_name, interest_category FROM customers JOIN interests ON customers.customer_id = interests.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY last_name ASC
SELECT first_name, city, state FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female' ORDER BY first_name DESC
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, city, state FROM customers WHERE state = 'California' AND age BETWEEN 25 AND 40
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, interest_category FROM customers c JOIN interests i ON c.customer_id = i.customer_id WHERE interest_level > 3 ORDER BY first_name
SELECT p.product_name, p.price, p.quantity, c.first_name, c.last_name FROM purchases p JOIN customers c ON p.customer_id = c.customer_id WHERE purchase_date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY p.price DESC
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, age, city FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT purchase_amount, purchase_date FROM purchases ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT income, education_level FROM demographics WHERE marital_status = 'Married';
SELECT segment_name, description FROM marketing_segments WHERE segment_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT customer_id, name, city FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Male' AND city = 'New York';

SELECT c.name, d.income, s.segment_name FROM customers c INNER JOIN demographics d ON c.customer_id = d.customer_id INNER JOIN segment_customers sc ON c.customer_id = sc.customer_id INNER JOIN marketing_segments s ON sc.segment_id = s.segment_id WHERE d.income > 50000 AND s.segment_name = 'VIP';
SELECT p.customer_id, SUM(p.purchase_amount) AS total_purchase, AVG(p.purchase_amount) AS avg_purchase FROM purchases p GROUP BY p.customer_id HAVING total_purchase > 1000 ORDER BY avg_purchase DESC;

SELECT c.name, d.education_level, COUNT(pc.segment_id) AS num_segments FROM customers c JOIN demographics d ON c.customer_id = d.customer_id LEFT JOIN segment_customers pc ON c.customer_id = pc.customer_id GROUP BY c.name, d.education_level HAVING num_segments > 2 ORDER BY num_segments DESC;
